required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Healthy Volunteer Study of the Securis™ Stabilization Device
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Healthy Volunteer Study of the Securis™ Stabilization Device

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to assess the performance of the Securis™ Stabilization Device in simulated clinical use.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is designed to collect prospective observational data related to the safety and performance of the Securis™ Stabilization Device in healthy volunteers utilizing a simulated use method. Participants will have an intravenous catheter applied (not inserted) onto their forearm with a Securis™ Stabilization Device applied over it. The site/device will be assessed over a period of 9 days (ideally Days 0-7 in-clinic and Day 8 virtually). The assessments will include the appearance of the site, the appearance of the dressing, and the movement of the catheter tip under the dressing.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Securis™ Stabilization Device Securement Failure During Simulated Use
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of placement and up to 8 days after removal
primary_outcome.description: Device securement failure is defined as any of the following: Loose dressing Soiled under dressing Complete failure (complete removal) Dislodgement of device or catheter

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Select Skin Conditions Observed During Securis™ Stabilization Device Use
primary_outcome.time_frame: From placement and up tp to 24 hours after device removal
primary_outcome.description: Select skin conditions include any of the following: Blister Rash Skin tear Bruising Exudate

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Securis™ Stabilization Device-related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From placement and up to 24 hours after device removal
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of device-related adverse events calculated as the number of participants with adverse events related to the device divided by the total number of evaluable participants.

arm_group.description: A minimum of 100 healthy volunteer participants (14yo and older)

intervention.description: A trained clinician will apply and remove, and participants will wear the Securis™ Stabilization Device for up to one week (7 days) on their forearm. A shortened catheter will be placed (not inserted) over the Securis™ device in accordance with the product Information for Use (IFU), and an extension set attached to the catheter and secured in place, to simulate clinical use.

study_pop.textblock: Potential participants will be recruited from healthy volunteer participant pools identified and/or held by the study site.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ≥14 years of age, regardless of gender, at the time of informed consent
2. Is expected to be available through Day 8 of the study
3. Is expected to understand and follow the study procedures including applicable restrictions in activities (e.g., limited physical exercise, no swimming, no use of lotions/moisturizers, etc.)
4. Provision of signed and dated informed consent form. Note: Consent of a parent of legal guardian will be require for participants <18 years of age; assent will also be required for these participants
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Significant scarring at the device application site
2. Has any skin condition that might affect device adherence or the ability of study staff to perform skin assessments
3. Has any condition or is taking any medication that might cause excessive bruising, bleeding, or skin tearing (e.g., anti-coagulant therapy)
4. Known allergy to study device/components or ancillary devices
5. Will be unable to complete a remote visit via video chat, if required
6. Has any condition which, in the opinion of the Investigator, precludes them from participation in this study.
